docs.summary: A gallery for displaying multiple items.
description: There are many different types and styles of galleries, some of which do not
support all of the properties and functions described below. To determine
what functionality a specific gallery supports, use its
[`galleryCapabilities`](#galleryCapabilities) property to identify its
capabilities. Then use the list below to determine what functionality is
supported by the gallery.
+ All galleries
+ [`clickAction`](#clickAction)
+ [`collapsed`](#collapsed)
+ [`galleryCapabilities`](#galleryCapabilities)
+ [`global`](#global)
+ [`hidden`](#hidden)
+ [`items`](#items)
+ [`isVisible`](#isVisible)
+ [`parent`](#parent)
+ [`rendered`](#rendered)
+ [`type`](#type)
+ [`collapse()`](#collapse)
+ [`expand()`](#expand)
+ [`hide()`](#hide)
+ [`onClick()`](#onClick)
+ [`onDblClick()`](#onDblClick)
+ [`onItemClicked()`](#onItemClicked)
+ [`onMouseIn()`](#onMouseIn)
+ [`onMouseOut()`](#onMouseOut)
+ [`onViewportEnter()`](#onViewportEnter)
+ [`onViewportLeave()`](#onViewportLeave)
+ [`scrollTo()`](#scrollTo)
+ [`show()`](#show)
+ Galleries where `hasCurrentItem` is `true`
+ [`currentIndex`](#currentIndex)
+ [`currentItem`](#currentItem)
+ [`onCurrentItemChanged()`](#onCurrentItemChanged)
+ Galleries where `isPlayable` is `true`
+ [`isPlaying`](#isPlaying)
+ [`next()`](#next)
+ [`onPause()`](#onPause)
+ [`onPlay()`](#onPlay)
+ [`pause()`](#pause)
+ [`play()`](#play)
+ [`previous()`](#previous)
+ Galleries where `hasNavigationButtons` is `true`
+ [`showNavigationButtons`](#showNavigationButtons)

docs.summary: Sets or gets the action that occurs when an item in the gallery is clicked.
description: Setting the `clickAction` property sets what happens when
an item in the gallery is clicked.
The value can be set to:
+ `"none"`: Nothing happens.
+ `"expand"`: The item opens in a popup window.
+ `"link"`: The item's link opens.
Getting the `clickAction` property returns what happens when
an item in the gallery is clicked.

examples.title: Get the action that occurs when an item in the gallery is clicked
Set the action that occurs when an item in the gallery is clicked

docs.summary: Gets the index of the gallery's current item.
description: The indices of the items in a gallery are zero-based. For example, if
the third item is currently being displayed, then `currentIndex`
returns `2`.

examples.title: Get the index of the gallery's current item

notes:
The `currentIndex` property is supported by galleries where the
 `hasCurrentItem` [capability](#GalleryCapabilities) is `true`.

 If you [change the gallery's type](https://www.wix.com/support/html5/article/changing-the-gallery-type)
 to one that doesn't support `currentIndex` and you try to use it, your code may no longer function correctly.

docs.summary: Gets an object containing information about the current item.

notes:
The `currentItem` property is supported by galleries where the
 `hasCurrentItem` [capability](#GalleryCapabilities) is `true`.

 If you [change the gallery's type](https://www.wix.com/support/html5/article/changing-the-gallery-type)
 to one that doesn't support `hasCurrentItem` and you try to use
 it, your code may no longer function correctly.

docs.summary: Gets an object containing information about the gallery's capabilities.
Sets or gets the items in a gallery.
description: Setting the `items` property sets the gallery items that make up the gallery.
Set `items` to an empty array (`[]`) to remove the current gallery items.
Getting the `items` property returns the current list of gallery items
that make up the gallery.
You cannot modify the gallery item array in-place. To add, change, or
remove individual gallery items:
1. Store the value of the `items` property in a variable.
1. Make changes to the gallery items array.
1. Reset the `items` property with the modified array.

examples.title: Get the list of items and the first item's information
Set the list of items for a gallery
Add an item to a gallery

notes:
You can only get the items of a Pro Gallery using the `items` property
 if you set its items using the `items` property or connect the gallery
 to a dataset first. If you set the gallery's items in the Editor, you
 are not be able to retrieve them with the `items` property. This limitation
 does not apply to standard galleries.

 To determine if your gallery is a Pro Gallery, hover over the gallery while
 it is not selected. The gallery type appears above the upper left corner
 of the gallery. If the type is "Wix Pro Gallery", then your gallery is a
 Pro Gallery. If the type is anything other than "Wix Pro Gallery", the
 limitation described above does not apply to your gallery.

docs.summary: Determines if a gallery's navigation arrows are shown.
description: A gallery's navigation arrows allow a user to click through the items in
the gallery.

notes:
The `showNavigationButtons` property is supported by galleries where
 the `hasNavigationButtons` [capability](#GalleryCapabilities) is `true`.

 If you [change the gallery's type](https://www.wix.com/support/html5/article/changing-the-gallery-type)
 to one that doesn't support `hasNavigationButtons` and you try to use
 it, your code may no longer function correctly.

params.name: handler
params.doc:
The name of the
 function or the function expression to run when the gallery's current
 item changes.

ret.doc: The gallery that triggered the event.

docs.summary: Adds an event handler that runs when a gallery's current item changes.
description: A gallery's current item changes through playing or certain user
interactions.

examples.title: Get the information of the item that changed

notes: The `onCurrentItemChanged()` function is supported by galleries where the `hasCurrentItem` [capability](#GalleryCapabilities) is `true`. If you [change the gallery's type](https://www.wix.com/support/html5/article/changing-the-gallery-type) to one that doesn't support `hasCurrentItem` and you try to use it, your code may no longer function correctly. **Deprecation note:** The $w parameter of event handlers is being deprecated. To get a scoped selector, use the $w.at() function and pass it the context property of the event parameter: $item = $w.at(event.context). To learn more, see here.

params.name: handler
params.doc:
The name of the
 function or the function expression to run when a gallery item is
 clicked.

ret.doc: The gallery that triggered the event.

docs.summary:
Adds an event handler that runs when an item in a gallery is
 clicked.

examples.title: Get the information of the item that was clicked

notes: **Deprecation note:** The $w parameter of event handlers is being deprecated. To get a scoped selector, use the $w.at() function and pass it the context property of the event parameter: $item = $w.at(event.context). To learn more, see here.

docs.summary: An object used by the `galleryCapabilities` property that contains the capabilities of a gallery.

members.name: isPlayable
members.doc: Indicates if the gallery supports play operations.

members.name: hasCurrentItem
members.doc: Indicates if the gallery supports the notion of a current item.

members.name: hasNavigationButtons
members.doc: Indicates if the gallery supports navigation buttons.

docs.summary: An object used by the Gallery properties `items` and `currentItem` to represent a single item in a gallery.
description: The `src` property of a `GalleryItem` for a Pro Gallery can be:
+ An image from the Media Manager
+ An external image from any web location
+ A video from the Media Manager
The `src` property of a `GalleryItem` for a standard gallery can be:
+ An image from the Media Manager
+ An external image from any web location (some galleries do not support external images)
To determine if your gallery is a Pro Gallery or a standard gallery, hover
over the gallery while it is not selected. The gallery type appears above
the upper left corner of the gallery. If the type is "Wix Pro Gallery", then
your gallery is a Pro Gallery. If the type is anything other than "Wix Pro
Gallery", your gallery gallery is a standard gallery.
The URL formats supported are:
+ Images from the Media Manager:
`wix:image://v1/<uri>/<filename>/#originWidth=<width>&originHeight=<height>[&watermark=<watermark_manifest_string>]`
+ Videos from the Media Manager:
`wix:video://v1/<video_uri>/<filename>/#posterUri=<poster_uri>&posterWidth=<width>&posterHeight=<height>`
+ Images from the web:
`http(s)://<image url>`

srcDocs.summary: An object used by the Gallery properties `items` and `currentItem` to represent a single item in a gallery.
description: The `src` property of a `GalleryItem` for a Pro Gallery can be:
+ An image from the Media Manager

+ A video from the Media Manager
The `src` property of a `GalleryItem` for a standard gallery can be:

+ An external image from any web location (some galleries do not support external images)
To determine if your gallery is a Pro Gallery or a standard gallery, hover
over the gallery while it is not selected. The gallery type appears above
the upper left corner of the gallery. If the type is "Wix Pro Gallery", then
your gallery is a Pro Gallery. If the type is anything other than "Wix Pro
Gallery", your gallery gallery is a standard gallery.
The URL formats supported are:

`wix:image://v1/<uri>/<filename>/#originWidth=<width>&originHeight=<height>[&watermark=<watermark_manifest_string>]`
+ Videos from the Media Manager:
`wix:video://v1/<video_uri>/<filename>/#posterUri=<poster_uri>&posterWidth=<width>&posterHeight=<height>`
+ Images from the web:
`http(s)://<image url>`

members.name: target
members.docs: The target of the link, either `"_blank"` or `"_self"`
members.srcDocs: The target of the link, either `"_blank"` or `"_self"`

docs.summary: An object used by the Gallery properties `items` and `currentItem` to represent a single gallery image.
description: The `src` property of a `ImageItem` can be:
+ An image from the Media Manager.
+ An external image from any web location (some galleries do not support external images).
The image source format for Media Manager images is:
`wix:image://v1/<uri>/<filename>#originWidth=<width>&originHeight=<height>[&watermark=<watermark_manifest_string>]`

members.name: description
members.doc: Image description. Descriptions over 100 characters are truncated.

members.name: link
members.doc: URL of the image's clickable link. See [here]($w.LinkableMixin.html#link) for more information about links.

docs.summary: An object representing an gallery image item's settings properties.

members.name: amount
members.docs: Image amount setting for image sharpening.

members.name: radius
members.docs: Image radius setting for image sharpening.

members.name: threshold
members.docs: Image threshold setting for image sharpening.

docs.summary: An object used by the Gallery properties `items` and `currentItem` to represent a single gallery text box.
description: A `TextItem` can be used as an item in a Pro Gallery.
To determine if your gallery is a Pro Gallery or a standard gallery, hover
over the gallery while it is not selected. The gallery type appears above
the upper left corner of the gallery. If the type is "Wix Pro Gallery", then
your gallery is a Pro Gallery. If the type is anything other than "Wix Pro
Gallery", your gallery gallery is a standard gallery.

docs.summary: An object used by the Gallery properties `items` and `currentItem` to represent a single gallery video.
description: A `VideoItem` can be used as an item in a Pro Gallery.
To determine if your gallery is a Pro Gallery or a standard gallery, hover
over the gallery while it is not selected. The gallery type appears above
the upper left corner of the gallery. If the type is "Wix Pro Gallery", then
your gallery is a Pro Gallery. If the type is anything other than "Wix Pro
Gallery", your gallery gallery is a standard gallery.
The video source format is:
`wix:video://v1/<video_uri>/<filename>#posterUri=<poster_uri>&posterWidth=<width>&posterHeight=<height>`
